texts.value: Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles. Involved in the formation of glutathione conjugates of both prostaglandin A2 (PGA2) and prostaglandin J2 (PGJ2) (PubMed:9084911). Participates in the formation of novel hepoxilin regioisomers (PubMed:21046276)

reaction.name: RX + glutathione = an S-substituted glutathione + a halide anion + H(+)

maximumVelocities.enzyme: enzyme for the formation of the glutathione-S-conjugate of prostaglandin A2 (at pH 7.0 and 37 degrees Celsius)
enzyme for the formation of the glutathione-S-conjugate of prostaglandin J2 (at pH 7.0 and 37 degrees Celsius)

michaelisConstants.substrate: prostaglandin A2 (at pH 7.0 and 37 degrees Celsius)

texts.value: There are two alleles; GSTM1A and GSTM1B which differ in position 173. The sequence shown is that of allele GSTM1A
